title: Product Manager Surgical Tools (m/f) - MED-EL Medical Electronics
subtitle: Innsbruck, T 6020
body:
MED-EL is a leading manufacturer of innovative medical devices for the treatment of various types and degrees of hearing loss. Our unique portfolio of implantable hearing solutions benefits thousands of individuals in more than 100 countries worldwide. With headquarters in Innsbruck, Austria, MED-EL has over 2200 employees around the world. In support of our continuing growth, we currently have an open position with focus on:
Apply online

Product Manager Surgical
Tools (m/f)

PM_1_1907
Innsbruck, Austria

Main Tasks

  • Become proficient with our products, surgical tools and the surgical procedures, to engage in expert conversations and counselling for surgeons as well as for R&D, marketing, training, sales, and other corporate teams
  • Develop and maintain specific procedural knowledge and key surgeon relationships by attending cases
  • Collaborate with R&D on the development of new surgical tools, increasing usability and compiling of surgical sets
  • Be the main contact within Product Management and across departments for surgical tools for all aspects of customer feedback, requirements definitions, portfolio planning, product positioning and lifecycle management
  • Develop materials for professionals, sales and marketing and provide on-site product demonstrations and support to surgeons, OR staff and other stakeholders

Requirements

  • Degree in a technical, life sciences or economic discipline, proficient in English; German skills are a plus
  • Hands-on experience with implants, surgical tools or in related fields strongly preferred
  • Ability to think critically with a strong attention to detail combined with a customer focused mindset
  • Strong team-player and problem-solver with a supportive attitude and a creative, independent and innovative approach
  • Willingness to travel domestically and internationally (up to 25% as needed)




Salary will be determined based on professional experience; the formal minimum salary according to Collective Bargaining Agreement is EUR 37,022.44

We offer a challenging opportunity in a multinational work environment with English as our company language. We look forward to receiving your application at jobs.medel.com
